intro: Euryptera, commonly known as the "false hellebore," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its erect, often branched stems and alternate, ovate to lanceolate leaves. The flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences, typically greenish or reddish in color. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain several seeds. Euryptera species are typically found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream sides.
